ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

ErrorResponse.description: Generic error response for REST APIs

code.description: the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

details.description: The optional details of the error response.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists. This needs to be
flexible so we can support multiple formats

internal.description: Internal error code in cases where we don't have an array of errors

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request

type.description:
URI pointing at a document that describes the error and mitigation steps
If there is no document, point to the RFC for the HTTP error code

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: A valid name is made up of one or more components where each component is separated by period characters.  Each component must start and end with a lower case alphanumeric character and the body of the component is made up of zero or more lower case alphanumeric and hyphen characters.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

com.nokia.eda.filters.v1alpha1.ControlPl.description: ControlPlaneFilter is the Schema for the controlplanefilters API

spec.description: ControlPlaneFilter allows for specifying a list of Nodes or Node selectors where the filter should be applied and managing filter entries in order.

entries.description: Specifies the list of filter entries, in order.

action.description: An action to take, either 'accept', or 'drop'.
action.title: Action

destinationPortName.description: Destination port to match by name.
destinationPortName.title: Destination Port Name

destinationPortNumber.description: Destination port to match by numerical value.
destinationPortNumber.title: Destination Port Number

destinationPortOperator.description: Operator to use when matching destinationPort, either Equals, GreaterOrEquals, or LessOrEquals.
destinationPortOperator.title: Destination Port Operator

destinationPortRange.description: Range of destination ports to match, in the format n-m, e.g. 100-200,  The start and end of the range must be port numbers.
destinationPortRange.title: Destination Port Range

icmpCode.description: Match a specific ICMP code, as a number between 0-255, e.g. 0.
icmpCode.title: ICMP Code

icmpTypeName.description: Match a specific ICMP type by name, e.g. dest-unreachable.
icmpTypeName.title: ICMP Type Name

icmpTypeNumber.description: Match a specific ICMP type by number.
icmpTypeNumber.title: ICMP Type Number

protocolName.description: Match a specific IP protocol name (specified in the type field of the IP header).
protocolName.title: Protocol Name

ui-defaults.condition: !ipEntry.protocolName && ((ipEntry.sourcePortNumber || ipEntry.sourcePortRange !== '' || ipEntry.sourcePortName !== '' || ipEntry.destinationPortNumber || ipEntry.destinationPortRange !== '' || ipEntry.destinationPortName !== '') || ipEntry.tcpFlags !== '')

protocolNumber.description: Match a specific IP protocol number (specified in the type field of the IP header).
protocolNumber.title: Protocol Number

rateLimit.description: Rate limit to apply when the action is 'RateLimit'.

burstSize.description: The maximum burst size in bytes.
burstSize.title: Burst Size

entrySpecificPolicer.description: Controls policer instantiation: false for shared instance, true for per-entry instances
entrySpecificPolicer.title: Entry Specific Policer

peakRate.description: The peak rate in kilobytes per second.
peakRate.title: Peak Rate

scope.description: Determines how the policer is applied across subinterfaces. Global applies the policer across all subinterfaces, while Subinterface applies it individually to each subinterface.
scope.title: Scope

rateLimit.title: Rate Limit

sourcePortName.description: Source port to match by name.
sourcePortName.title: Source Port Name

sourcePortNumber.description: Source port to match by numerical value.
sourcePortNumber.title: Source Port Number

sourcePortOperator.description: Operator to use when matching sourcePort, either Equals, GreaterOrEquals, or LessOrEquals.
sourcePortOperator.title: Source Port Operator

sourcePortRange.description: Range of source ports to match, in the format n-m, e.g. 100-200.  The start and end of the range must be port numbers.
sourcePortRange.title: Source Port Range

tcpFlags.description: Match TCP flags, usable with !, &, | and the flags RST, SYN, and ACK.
tcpFlags.title: TCP Flags

ui-conditions.condition: !((ipEntry.action === undefined) && (ipEntry.sourcePortNumber !== null || ipEntry.destinationPortNumber !== null || ipEntry.sourcePrefix !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPrefix !== undefined || ipEntry.soucePortRange !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortRange !== undefined || ipEntry.sourcePortName !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortName !== undefined || ipEntry.sourcePortOperator !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortOperator !== undefined || ipEntry.protocolNumber !== null || ipEntry.protocolName !== undefined || ipEntry.icmpTypeName !== undefined || ipEntry.icmpTypeNumber !== null || ipEntry.tcpFlags !== undefined || ipEntry.firstFragment !== false || ipEntry.fragment !== false))
ui-conditions.errorMsg: An IP action must be set if any of the IP fields are set.
Fragment match must be enabled when First Fragment match is enabled.
Only one of Source Port Number, Source Port Range or Source Port Name can be set at a time.
Only one of Destination Port Number, Destination Port Range or Destination Port Name can be set at a time.
Only one of the Protocol Number or Protocol Name can be set at a time.

ui-conditions.condition: !((ipEntry.sourcePortNumber !== null || ipEntry.destinationPortNumber !== null || ipEntry.sourcePortRange !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortRange !== undefined || ipEntry.sourcePortName !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortName !== undefined) && (ipEntry.protocolNumber === null && ipEntry.protocolName === undefined))
ui-conditions.errorMsg: Protocol Name or Protocol Number must be set if any of the Source/Destination Port or Port Range fields are set.

ui-conditions.condition: !((ipEntry.sourcePortNumber !== null || ipEntry.destinationPortNumber !== null || ipEntry.sourcePortRange !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortRange !== undefined || ipEntry.sourcePortName !== undefined || ipEntry.destinationPortName !== undefined) && !((ipEntry.protocolNumber === 6 || ipEntry.protocolNumber === 17) || (ipEntry.protocolName === 'TCP' || ipEntry.protocolName === 'UDP')))
ui-conditions.errorMsg: Protocol must be TCP or UDP if any of the Source/Destination Port or Port Range fields are set.

ui-conditions.condition: (ipEntry.icmpTypeName === undefined && ipEntry.icmpTypeNumber === null) || (ipEntry.icmpTypeName !== undefined && ipEntry.icmpTypeNumber === null) || (ipEntry.icmpTypeName === undefined && ipEntry.icmpTypeNumber !== null)
ui-conditions.errorMsg: Either ICMP Type Name or ICMP Type Number must be set, but not both.

action.description: An action to take, either 'accept', or 'drop'.
action.title: Action

destinationMAC.description: Match an Ethernet frame if its destination MAC address logically anded with the mask equals this MAC address.
destinationMAC.title: Destination MAC

destinationMACMask.description: Match an Ethernet frame if its destination MAC address logically anded with the mask equals the configured MAC address.
destinationMACMask.title: Destination MAC Mask

ethertype.description: An Ethernet frame matches this condition if its ethertype value (after 802.1Q VLAN tags) matches the specified value.
ethertype.title: Ethertype

outerVLANIDRange.title: Outer VLAN ID Range

outerVLANIDValue.description: Ethernet frame matching criteria based on the outermost VLAN ID found before the subinterface-defining VLAN tag (if any) is removed. A value of 'none' will match only untagged frames.
outerVLANIDValue.title: Outer VLAN ID Value

burstSize.title: Burst Size

entrySpecificPolicer.title: Entry Specific Policer

peakRate.description: The peak rate in kilobytes per second.
peakRate.title: Peak Rate

scope.description: Determines how the policer is applied across subinterfaces. Global applies the policer across all subinterfaces, while Subinterface applies it individually to each subinterface.
scope.title: Scope

sourceMAC.description: Match an Ethernet frame if its source MAC address logically anded with the mask equals this MAC address.
sourceMAC.title: Source MAC

sourceMACMask.description: Match an Ethernet frame if its source MAC address logically anded with the mask equals the configured MAC address.
sourceMACMask.title: Source MAC Mask

ui-conditions.condition: !((macEntry.action === undefined) && (macEntry.sourceMAC !== undefined || macEntry.destinationMAC !== undefined || macEntry.sourceMACMask !== undefined || macEntry.destinationMACMask !== undefined || macEntry.outerVLANIDValue !== undefined || macEntry.outerVLANIDRange !== undefined || macEntry.outerVLANIDOperator !== undefined || macEntry.ethertype !== undefined))

A mask must be set when a Source MAC is configured

com.nokia.eda.filters.v1alpha1.Filter.description: Filter is the Schema for the filters API

spec.description: Filter allows for the creation and management of ordered filtering rules based on IP or MAC criteria. The resource supports various conditions and actions, enabling fine-grained control over network traffic by specifying rules for source and destination addresses, ports, and protocols.

entries.description: Specifies the list of filter entries, in order.
